name: Backpack
description: A backpack is a sturdy, multi-pocketed bag made of leather or canvas, designed to be worn on the back and used to carry adventuring gear, supplies, and personal belongings.

name: Rations (iron or standard)
description: Rations are preserved food supplies, typically consisting of dried meats, hardtack, nuts, and other non-perishable items, designed to sustain adventurers during long journeys. Iron rations are more durable and long-lasting compared to standard rations.

name: Waterskin
description: A waterskin is a durable, often leather container used to carry water or other liquids, essential for adventurers to stay hydrated during their journeys.

name: Torch
description: A torch is a wooden stick wrapped in cloth and soaked in a flammable substance, used to provide light in dark areas. It can also be used as a makeshift weapon or to ignite other objects.

name: Lantern
description: A lantern is a portable light source, typically made of metal and glass, designed to protect a flame or light source from the elements while providing illumination. It is often used by adventurers to explore dark areas such as caves or dungeons.

name: Rope (hemp or silk)
description: A sturdy length of rope, available in either hemp or silk. Hemp rope is rough and durable, ideal for climbing and securing loads, while silk rope is lighter, more flexible, and less prone to fraying, often used for more delicate tasks.

name: Grappling Hook
description: A grappling hook is a sturdy, multi-pronged metal hook attached to a length of rope, used for climbing, securing, or retrieving objects from a distance.

name: Lockpicks
description: A set of lockpicks consists of various slender tools designed to manipulate the internal mechanisms of locks, allowing skilled individuals to unlock doors, chests, and other secured items without the proper key.

name: Crowbar
description: A crowbar is a sturdy, iron tool with a curved, forked end, used for prying open crates, doors, and other sealed objects. It is a versatile tool for adventurers needing to break into or out of places.

name: Climbing Gear (pitons, carabiners, harness)
description: A set of climbing gear including pitons, carabiners, and a harness, essential for scaling steep cliffs and navigating treacherous mountainous terrain. This equipment ensures safety and stability for adventurers during their climbs.

name: Map and Compass
description: A map and compass set is an essential tool for navigation, consisting of a detailed map of the region and a reliable compass to help adventurers find their way through unfamiliar terrain.

name: Healer's Kit
description: A healer's kit is a small pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints, used to stabilize the wounded and treat minor injuries. It is an essential tool for any adventurer looking to provide first aid in the field.

name: Tent
description: A tent is a portable shelter made of durable fabric, supported by poles and ropes, providing adventurers with a temporary home and protection from the elements during their journeys.

name: Mirror
description: A mirror is a polished surface, typically made of glass with a reflective coating, used to see one's reflection. It can be used for personal grooming, signaling, or even in certain magical rituals.

name: 10-Foot Pole
description: A 10-foot pole is a long, sturdy wooden or metal rod, often used by adventurers to probe for traps, measure distances, or reach objects from a safe distance.

name: Blanket or Bedroll
description: A blanket or bedroll is a thick, warm covering or a portable sleeping mat, often made of wool or other insulating materials, used by adventurers to stay warm and comfortable during rest periods in the wilderness.

name: Flint and Steel
description: A small, essential toolset consisting of a piece of flint and a steel striker, used to create sparks and ignite fires. It is a reliable and reusable method for adventurers to start campfires or signal fires.

name: Potion Vials
description: Potion vials are small, glass containers used to hold various magical potions and elixirs. They are often sealed with a cork or wax to prevent spillage and are essential for any adventurer looking to carry healing potions, poisons, or other magical liquids.

name: Sack or Bag
description: A sack or bag is a simple container made of cloth, leather, or other flexible material, used to carry and store various items and supplies during an adventure.

name: Spyglass
description: A spyglass is a small, handheld telescope made of brass and glass, used by adventurers and sailors to see distant objects more clearly. It is often used for scouting and navigation.
